definition: to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
according to/to act in accordance with/to depend on/to seize/to occupy
texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up
to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)

sentences.english: You can stand up for your right.
sentences.chinese: 你可以为你的权利据理力争。

definition: to twist words and force logic (idiom)/sophistry/loud rhetoric making up for fallacious argument/shoving false arguments down people's throats
present the facts and reason things out
pinyin: bai3 shi4 shi2 jiang3 dao4 li3

definition: to move aside/to get out of the way/to back down/to concede
to speak out for justice (idiom); to take a stand on a matter of principle
to speak forcibly out of a sense of righteousness (idiom)
fight a battle of words/cross verbal swords
to speak forcefully and with justice (idiom); to argue with the courage of one's convictions
